prompt:
Generate API calls based on the provided commands, ensuring compliance with the specified rules and precise execution. You must determine the parent-child relationships of elements based on indentation and ensure that all

and elements are modified. Each command follows this format: (element_class, type, quantity_change: int, old_data, new_data). Available APIs def replace_image(img_id: int, image_path: str) Replace an image in a slide. Args: slide (SlidePage): The slide containing the image. img_id (int): The ID of the image to replace. image_path (str): The path to the new image. Raises: ValueError: If the image path does not exist. def del_image(figure_id: int) Delete an image from a slide. Args: slide (SlidePage): The slide containing the image. figure_id (int): The ID of the image to delete. def clone_paragraph(div_id: int, paragraph_id: int) Clone a paragraph in a slide. Args: slide (SlidePage): The slide containing the paragraph. div_id (int): The ID of the division containing the paragraph. paragraph_id (int): The ID of the paragraph to clone. Raises: IndexError: If the paragraph is not found. Mention: the cloned paragraph will have a paragraph_id one greater than the current maximum in the parent element. def replace_paragraph(div_id: int, paragraph_id: int, text: str) Replace the text of a paragraph in a slide. Args: slide (SlidePage): The slide containing the paragraph. div_id (int): The ID of the division containing the paragraph. paragraph_id (int): The ID of the paragraph to replace. text (str): The new text to replace with. Raises: IndexError: If the paragraph is not found. def del_paragraph(div_id: int, paragraph_id: int) Delete a paragraph from a slide. Args: slide (SlidePage): The slide containing the paragraph. div_id (int): The ID of the division containing the paragraph. paragraph_id (int): The ID of the paragraph to delete. Raises: IndexError: If the paragraph is not found. Steps 1. Quantity Adjustment: - If quantity_change = 0, modify the content only. - If quantity_change > 0, use clone_paragraph to add the specified number of paragraphs from the same element_class. The paragraph_id for newly cloned paragraphs should be the current maximum paragraph_id of the parent element plus 1. - If quantity_change < 0, use del_paragraph or del_image to remove the specified number of tail elements. - Each command’s API call group must exclusively use either clone_paragraph or del_paragraph/del_image based on the `quantity_change` 2. Content Modification: - Text Content: Use replace_paragraph to modify the content. - Image Content: Use replace_image to replace image resources. 3. Output Format: - Add comments to each API call group, explaining the intent of the original command and the associated element_class. - For cloning operations, annotate the paragraph_id of the newly created paragraphs. Example Input:

WorldFAIR: Global cooperation on FAIR data policy and practice

  • Two-year project to advance implementation...
  • Funded by the European Union...
[ ("title", "text", "quantity_change: 0", ["WorldFAIR: Global cooperation on FAIR data policy and practice"], ["New Title"]), ("project_description", "text", "quantity_change: 1", ["Two-year project to advance implementation of the FAIR principles"], ["New project description1", "New project description2"]), ("funding_info", "text", "quantity_change: -1", ["Funded by the European Union"], []), ("project_logo", "image", "quantity_change: 0", ["logo: project of xx"], ["new_logo.png"]) ] Example Output # ("title", "text", "quantity_change: 0", ["WorldFAIR: Global cooperation on FAIR data policy and practice"], ["New Title"]) replace_paragraph(0, 0, "New Title") # ("project_description", "text", "quantity_change: 1", ["Two-year project to advance implementation of the FAIR principles"], ["New project description1", "New project description2"]) clone_paragraph(1, 0) # New cloned paragraph_id is 2 as the current max paragraph_id is 1 replace_paragraph(1, 0, "New project description1") replace_paragraph(1, 2, "New project description2") # ("funding_info", "text", "quantity_change: -1", ["Funded by the European Union"], []) del_paragraph(1, 1) # ("project_logo", "image", "quantity_change: 0", ["logo: project of xx"], ["new_logo.png"]) replace_image(2, "new_logo.png") Current Slide Content: Tourism & Culture:

Tourism & Culture:

APPRECIATING THE TANGIBLE & THE INTANGIBLE OF BHUBANESWAR THROUGH CULTURAL TOURISM

By Ayona Bhaduri

Command List: ('slide_title', 'text', 'quantity_change: 0', ['Tourism & Culture:'], ['OpenAI History']) ('main_title', 'text', 'quantity_change: 0', ['APPRECIATING THE TANGIBLE & THE INTANGIBLE OF BHUBANESWAR THROUGH CULTURAL TOURISM'], ['Pioneering the Future of Artificial Intelligence']) ('presenters', 'text', 'quantity_change: -1', ['By Ayona Bhaduri'], []) Please output only the API call sequence, one call per line, wrapped in ```python and ```, with comments for corresponding commands.
response:
```python
# ('slide_title', 'text', 'quantity_change: 0', ['Tourism & Culture:'], ['OpenAI History'])
replace_paragraph(0, 0, "OpenAI History")

# ('main_title', 'text', 'quantity_change: 0', ['APPRECIATING THE TANGIBLE & THE INTANGIBLE OF BHUBANESWAR THROUGH CULTURAL TOURISM'], ['Pioneering the Future of Artificial Intelligence'])
replace_paragraph(1, 0, "Pioneering the Future of Artificial Intelligence")

# ('presenters', 'text', 'quantity_change: -1', ['By Ayona Bhaduri'], [])
del_paragraph(1, 1)
```

Example Input:

WorldFAIR: Global cooperation on FAIR data policy and practice

  • Two-year project to advance implementation...
  • Funded by the European Union...
[ ("title", "text", "quantity_change: 0", ["WorldFAIR: Global cooperation on FAIR data policy and practice"], ["New Title"]), ("project_description", "text", "quantity_change: 1", ["Two-year project to advance implementation of the FAIR principles"], ["New project description1", "New project description2"]), ("funding_info", "text", "quantity_change: -1", ["Funded by the European Union"], []), ("project_logo", "image", "quantity_change: 0", ["logo: project of xx"], ["new_logo.png"]) ] Example Output # ("title", "text", "quantity_change: 0", ["WorldFAIR: Global cooperation on FAIR data policy and practice"], ["New Title"]) replace_paragraph(0, 0, "New Title") # ("project_description", "text", "quantity_change: 1", ["Two-year project to advance implementation of the FAIR principles"], ["New project description1", "New project description2"]) clone_paragraph(1, 0) # New cloned paragraph_id is 2 as the current max paragraph_id is 1 replace_paragraph(1, 0, "New project description1") replace_paragraph(1, 2, "New project description2") # ("funding_info", "text", "quantity_change: -1", ["Funded by the European Union"], []) del_paragraph(1, 1) # ("project_logo", "image", "quantity_change: 0", ["logo: project of xx"], ["new_logo.png"]) replace_image(2, "new_logo.png") Current Slide Content: What is culture?

What is culture?

In Sri Aurobindo’s words,

The culture of a people may be described as the expression of a consciousness of life which formulates itself in three aspects.

There is a side of thought, of ideal, of upward will and soul’s aspiration, which is reflected in the people’s philosophy and religion.

There is a side of creative self-expression and appreciative aesthesis, intelligence and imagination, which finds expression in its art, poetry, literature, music, dance

And, there is a side of practical and outward formulation, which is provided for in its society and politics

Command List: ('main_title', 'text', 'quantity_change: 0', ['What is culture?'], ["OpenAI's Milestones"]) ('quote_introduction', 'text', 'quantity_change: 0', ['In Sri Aurobindo’s words,'], ['Discover past triumphs']) ('quote_content', 'text', 'quantity_change: 2', ['The culture of a people may be described as the expression of a consciousness of life which formulates itself in three aspects.', 'There is a side of thought, of ideal, of upward will and soul’s aspiration, which is reflected in the people’s philosophy and religion.', 'There is a side of creative self-expression and appreciative aesthesis, intelligence and imagination, which finds expression in its art, poetry, literature, music, dance', 'And, there is a side of practical and outward formulation, which is provided for in its society and politics'], ['OpenAI began with a $1 billion commitment from tech visionaries to drive AI research and attract talent.', '2016 saw the launch of OpenAI Gym, reshaping reinforcement learning with its groundbreaking toolkit.', 'The GPT series, from GPT in 2018 to GPT-3 in 2020, revolutionized natural language processing.', 'Advancements in reinforcement learning led to robotic systems excelling in complex tasks.', 'OpenAI prioritizes AI alignment to ensure the technology aligns with human goals, mitigating misuse risks.', 'Codex, launched in 2021, enhanced coding with natural language processing, powering GitHub Copilot.']) Please output only the API call sequence, one call per line, wrapped in ```python and ```, with comments for corresponding commands.
response:
```python
# ('main_title', 'text', 'quantity_change: 0', ['What is culture?'], ["OpenAI's Milestones"])
replace_paragraph(0, 0, "OpenAI's Milestones")

# ('quote_introduction', 'text', 'quantity_change: 0', ['In Sri Aurobindo’s words,'], ['Discover past triumphs'])
replace_paragraph(1, 0, 'Discover past triumphs')

# ('quote_content', 'text', 'quantity_change: 2', [...], [...])
clone_paragraph(1, 4)  # New cloned paragraph_id is 5 as the current max paragraph_id is 4
clone_paragraph(1, 5)  # New cloned paragraph_id is 6
clone_paragraph(1, 6)  # New cloned paragraph_id is 7
replace_paragraph(1, 1, 'OpenAI began with a $1 billion commitment from tech visionaries to drive AI research and attract talent.')
replace_paragraph(1, 2, '2016 saw the launch of OpenAI Gym, reshaping reinforcement learning with its groundbreaking toolkit.')
replace_paragraph(1, 3, 'The GPT series, from GPT in 2018 to GPT-3 in 2020, revolutionized natural language processing.')
replace_paragraph(1, 4, 'Advancements in reinforcement learning led to robotic systems excelling in complex tasks.')
replace_paragraph(1, 5, 'OpenAI prioritizes AI alignment to ensure the technology aligns with human goals, mitigating misuse risks.')
replace_paragraph(1, 6, 'Codex, launched in 2021, enhanced coding with natural language processing, powering GitHub Copilot.')
```

There is a side of thought, of ideal, of upward will and soul’s aspiration, which is reflected in the people’s philosophy and religion.

There is a side of creative self-expression and appreciative aesthesis, intelligence and imagination, which finds expression in its art, poetry, literature, music, dance

And, there is a side of practical and outward formulation, which is provided for in its society and politics

content.text:
Generate API calls based on the provided commands, ensuring compliance with the specified rules and precise execution. You must determine the parent-child relationships of elements based on indentation and ensure that all

and elements are modified. Each command follows this format: (element_class, type, quantity_change: int, old_data, new_data). Available APIs def replace_image(img_id: int, image_path: str) Replace an image in a slide. Args: slide (SlidePage): The slide containing the image. img_id (int): The ID of the image to replace. image_path (str): The path to the new image. Raises: ValueError: If the image path does not exist. def del_image(figure_id: int) Delete an image from a slide. Args: slide (SlidePage): The slide containing the image. figure_id (int): The ID of the image to delete. def clone_paragraph(div_id: int, paragraph_id: int) Clone a paragraph in a slide. Args: slide (SlidePage): The slide containing the paragraph. div_id (int): The ID of the division containing the paragraph. paragraph_id (int): The ID of the paragraph to clone. Raises: IndexError: If the paragraph is not found. Mention: the cloned paragraph will have a paragraph_id one greater than the current maximum in the parent element. def replace_paragraph(div_id: int, paragraph_id: int, text: str) Replace the text of a paragraph in a slide. Args: slide (SlidePage): The slide containing the paragraph. div_id (int): The ID of the division containing the paragraph. paragraph_id (int): The ID of the paragraph to replace. text (str): The new text to replace with. Raises: IndexError: If the paragraph is not found. def del_paragraph(div_id: int, paragraph_id: int) Delete a paragraph from a slide. Args: slide (SlidePage): The slide containing the paragraph. div_id (int): The ID of the division containing the paragraph. paragraph_id (int): The ID of the paragraph to delete. Raises: IndexError: If the paragraph is not found. Steps 1. Quantity Adjustment: - If quantity_change = 0, modify the content only. - If quantity_change > 0, use clone_paragraph to add the specified number of paragraphs from the same element_class. The paragraph_id for newly cloned paragraphs should be the current maximum paragraph_id of the parent element plus 1. - If quantity_change < 0, use del_paragraph or del_image to remove the specified number of tail elements. - Each command’s API call group must exclusively use either clone_paragraph or del_paragraph/del_image based on the `quantity_change` 2. Content Modification: - Text Content: Use replace_paragraph to modify the content. - Image Content: Use replace_image to replace image resources. 3. Output Format: - Add comments to each API call group, explaining the intent of the original command and the associated element_class. - For cloning operations, annotate the paragraph_id of the newly created paragraphs. Example Input:

WorldFAIR: Global cooperation on FAIR data policy and practice

  • Two-year project to advance implementation...
  • Funded by the European Union...
